content: We had over eighty thousand people in attendance,
which surpassed our wildest expectations.

I would like to specifically
single out Leslie Knope.

I speak for the mayor, city
council, and all of Pawnee
when I say we can't wait to see

what the heck
you're going to do next.
[GRUNTS]
Step on up here, Les.
[PEOPLE CLAPPING]
Thank you.

[GASPS]
Paul, are you okay?
Uh...
[ALL EXCLAIM]

Oh, my gosh.
Holy!
LESLIE: Oh, my God.
MAN: Call 911!

That was the second
most awkward way

a man has ever
grabbed my breast.

LESLIE: All right, guys.
Everybody, listen up.

Just a few notes about our
camping retreat tomorrow.

We're all gonna meet here
and leave as a group
at 6:45 a.m., promptly.
Why are we doing this?
Harvest Fest is over.

We do not wanna
have a sophomore slump.

This camping trip is our chance
to think of some really big ideas.

Why don't you just tell us
what our next project is,
and I'll go camping by myself.

Look, I have ideas, Ron.
Okay? I have, like, 100 new ideas.

But the point is,
the pressure is on.

We only have one chance
to make a second impression.

What portion of this camping
trip will take place outside?

All of it.
Pass.

Can't pass.
It's a mandatory work retreat.

I have a question. What
if we're scaling a cliff
and I start to fall?

Can I grab onto
your boob for support?

No, Tom, don't.
Her boob kills.

LESLIE: My boob
does not kill.

Paul did not die.
He had a heart attack,

which required
an octuple bypass.
Besides, the Pawnee Sun said that my chest saved his life.

How's the best municipal
department in Pawnee?
That's you guys.

Paul is going to be
recuperating for a while.

So, the mayor asked me
to step in as City Manager.

And I of course accepted
immediately because Pawnee is literally

the greatest
town in the country.

Of course,
I am gonna miss Indianapolis,

which is the most
wonderful city in America.

I'm so excited to be working
with you all again.

And Leslie, I cannot wait
to hear your new big idea.

I wanna hit the ground running,
and your new mystery project

is going to be
the hydration pack
that gets me to the finish line.

You're all my
little hydration packs.
I'm sure I am not.
Ron.
Are, too.
Hydration pack!
[LAUGHING]

Hey, you gotta hear this
hilarious story that he's telling me.
Tell her what happened.
My identity was stolen.
His identity was stolen.
Tell her about the accounts.
They were frozen.
Frozen.
Bye, Kyle.

Where are you going?
Oh, my God.

How's the coolest

What do you mean?

Leslie's making us go
on a camping retreat.

That's awesome.
Camping's the best.
Camping sucks.
It's super boring.

And you can see the stars,
which I hate. They're creepy.

I love camping. I bet you I

Why don't I meet you out there?

If you hate it, we'll leave and
go make out. But if you love it,

we'll stay and make out.
Either way, a ton of making out.
You in?

Ann Perkins.
Chris.

Hey. I heard you were back.
Yeah.
I didn't do this because of you.
Well, it looks great.

Yeah, you look great.
Am I right? It's...
So good running into you.

You know, we should get
together soon. I'd love to catch up.

Me, too.
Catch up and mustard.

Ketchup and mustard.
I just was...
Oh!
So delightful.
I relish your wit.
Well, I salsa your face.

I should hate him.
He broke up with me.

Well, there was an ex that I still

But it was really hard to stay mad
at him. He was an amazing dentist.

You know, when he saw me,
I swear his face lit up.
Ann.

What do you think "We should
get together soon" means?
No. Do not read into this.

Remember, this is the guy

when he broke up with you,

Yeah.
Come camping with us.

It'll be really fun. You'll be away

I'll give you

Okay. That sounds fun.

It divides our time evenly
between work and play.

Come on, everybody.
Let's hustle.
Let's get to the brainstorming!

I just wanna get the work

Fishing relaxes me.

It's like yoga, except I

All right.
I call this wonderful spot.
You didn't bring a tent?

I don't really go

So, I'm not going to

I'm just gonna
sleep on the floor.

It's called the ground

Why? Do you guys do

I've never been before,

Why am I gonna love it?
SkyMall.

Come check out my tent. I

I got my TV, my Xbox, DVD.
Awesome bed right there.
DJ Roomba's in the mix.
It's like I'm not even camping.
This is actually a dog couch,

It's really important to me
that April loves camping.

So, I went ahead and set up
the ultimate campsite love nest.
Complete with beautiful starlight.
We got champagne. Also, rose petals.
As you can see, they smell terrific.

We need big ideas, and we need

and return it to the citizens.

So, how much would

About 83 cents.
Per household.
Before postage.
Are we done?

Oh, I know this one.
They are all rappists.

Oh, my God.

have ever performed

Because we don't have

Until now.
The Pawnee Amphitheater.
How much would that cost?

Not that much.
$200, $300 million.

Right.
Great.
Luxury dog park.
Do you want to tell us any more?
Poodles only. No pooping.

Hey. Where are you?

I'm here.
Where are you?
We're inside the main entrance,

near the sign that says

I'm in a totally
different place.

That's why we

My God, Andy,
I don't even wanna be here.

The air is too fresh. It's

Sweetheart. Just hold tight

Well, April is right here.
And I am down here somewhere.

Make 4% a year.

You know, set up a nice

What do you think?

Great idea.
Thanks, white Urkel.

Shouldn't you be

And he's a valuable

Thank you.

I didn't come up

She's got a point.

That's what I'm calling my tent.

LESLIE: I am really

You know, the whole town

And you're letting 'em down.

Take an hour.
Go clear your heads

And also,
see if you're interested

in contributing
to this department.

Then, after that,
I will tell you my idea.

Wow. You really

Well, I had no choice. I

Why not?
Because I don't have one.
I don't have an idea, Ann.
I'm so screwed, Ann.

The meeting is tomorrow,
and I don't have anything.

Why not just build the park
on the lot behind my house?

Chris wants the new project
to generate revenue.

What about those
binders in your office?
They're filled with small ideas.
We need a big, juicy idea.

I'm so desperate, I even
brought in my dream journal,
hoping it would inspire me.

"I married ALF and
we're pretty happy."

That sounds nice.
It was.

Okay, listen to me. You are
smart and creative and talented,

and you're gonna be fine.
You're probably right.

I just need an hour

[CELL PHONE RINGING]
Hello?
Andy, you have to save me.

I'm camping with

Hello. April.
Hello?

Walk around in circles

Help triangulate the phone call.
Hello?

Hang on. I'm gonna try

[EXCLAIMING]

But I'm sorry, 16,

You know, I was 24 when

What say we just

You know what I should do? I should

That might be

[SIGHS]
Hey, Tom.

Uh...

All right.

Then you wouldn't

No, no, no.
